summary:
**Other Reactors**

* 16. Iran will rely only on light water for its future nuclear power and research reactors with enhanced international cooperation.
* 17. Iran intends to ship out all spent fuel for all future and present nuclear power and research reactors for further treatment or disposition.

**Spent Fuel Reprocessing Activities**

* 18. For 15 years, Iran will not engage in spent fuel reprocessing or spent fuel reprocessing R&D activities.
* 19. For 15 years, Iran will not reprocess spent fuel except for irradiated enriched uranium targets for production of radio-isotopes for medical and peaceful industrial purposes.
* 20. For 15 years, Iran will not develop, acquire or build facilities capable of separation of plutonium, uranium or neptunium from spent fuel or from fertile targets.
* 21. For 15 years, Iran will only develop, acquire, build, or operate hot cells with specific dimensions and specifications.
* 22. The E3/EU+3 are ready to facilitate examinations on fuel elements and/or fuel assembly prototypes.
* 23. For 15 years, Iran will undertake non-destructive post irradiation examination (PIE) of fuel pins, fuel assembly prototypes and structural materials at the Arak research reactor complex.
* 24. For 15 years, Iran will not engage in producing or acquiring plutonium or uranium metals or their alloys.
* 25. Iran will not produce, seek, or acquire separated plutonium, highly enriched uranium, or uranium-233, or neptunium-237 for 15 years.
* 26. If Iran seeks to initiate R&D on uranium metal based TRR fuel, it will present its plan to and seek approval by the Joint Commission.
Here is a summarized version of the document:

**ENRICHMENT CAPACITY**

* Iran will maintain its enrichment capacity at no more than 5,060 IR-1 centrifuge machines in 30 cascades at the Natanz Fuel Enrichment Plant (FEP) for 10 years (para. 27).
* Iran will limit uranium enrichment to up to 3.67 percent for 15 years (para. 28).
* Excess centrifuges and infrastructure will be stored at Natanz in Hall B of FEP under IAEA continuous monitoring (para. 29).
